definitions.definition: A large omnivorous mammal, related to the dog and raccoon, having shaggy hair, a very small tail, and flat feet; a member of family Ursidae.
A rough, unmannerly, uncouth person.
An investor who sells commodities, securities or futures in anticipation of a fall in prices.
A state policeman (short for smokey bear).
A large, hairy man, especially one who is homosexual.
A portable punching machine.
A block covered with coarse matting, used to scour the deck.
The fifteenth Lenormand card.
Something difficult or tiresome; a burden or chore.
definitions.example: That window can be a bear to open.

definitions.definition: To endeavour to depress the price of, or prices in.
(investments) Characterized by declining prices in securities markets or by belief that the prices will fall.
definitions.example: The great bear market starting in 1929 scared a whole generation of investors.

definitions.definition: To carry or convey, literally or figuratively.
definitions.example: Judging from the look on his face, he wasn't bearing good news.

definitions.definition: To support, sustain, or endure.
To support, keep up, or maintain.
To press or impinge upon.
To produce, yield, give birth to.
(originally nautical) To be, or head, in a specific direction or azimuth (from somewhere).
definitions.example: By my readings, we're bearing due south, so we should turn about ten degrees east.

definitions.definition: To gain or win.
Barley, especially four-rowed barley or six-rowed barley.
A pillowcase; a fabric case or covering as for a pillow.
